metadata.title: The Book of Curiosities of the Sciences
metadata.description: The يKitāb Gharāʾib al-funūn wa-mulaḥ al-ʿuyūn or Book of Curiosities is an Arabic cosmographical treatise. The manuscript is a copy, probably made in Egypt in the late 12th or early 13th century, of an anonymous work compiled in the first half of the 11th century in Egypt. The treatise is extraordinarily important for the history of science, especially for astronomy and cartography, and contains an unparalleled series of diagrams of the heavens and maps of the earth. It was acquired in June 2002 by the Bodleian Library.
